original: Exhibit 10.17(b) ---------------- FIRST AMENDMENT TO SAGEBRUSH MANAGEMENT AND MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT THIS FIRST AMENDMENT TO SAGEBRUSH MANAGEMENT AND MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT ("Amendment") is made and entered into as of December 1, 1990 by and among Sagebrush, a California general partnership ("Partnership"), the undersigned partners of the Partnership, being all of the Sagebrush partners ("Partners"), and ToyoWest Management Inc., a California corporation ("Manager"), with respect to the following facts and circumstances:
modified:
Exhibit 10.17(b) ---------------- SECOND REVISION TO SAGEBRUSH MANAGEMENT AND MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT

This SECOND REVISION TO SAGEBRUSH MANAGEMENT AND MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT ("Revision") is executed on December 1, 1990 by and among Sagebrush, a California general partnership ("Partnership"), the undersigned partners of the Partnership, being all of the Sagebrush partners ("Partners"), and ToyoWest Management Inc., a California corporation ("Manager"), in consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein:

The terms and conditions of this Revision are intended to modify and supersede certain provisions of the original Sagebrush Management and Maintenance Agreement dated as of an earlier date ("Agreement"), which remains in full force and effect except as modified by this Revision. Specifically, this Revision modifies Section 7.3(c) of the Agreement as follows:

In place of the existing obligation on the Partnership to maintain the Sagebrush property at a standard deemed acceptable by Manager, the Partnership's maintenance obligations shall now be subject to Manager's approval, with Manager bearing sole responsibility for determining the standard of maintenance for the Sagebrush property. This modification is intended to streamline the maintenance process and reduce potential disputes regarding the maintenance standard.

The Partners acknowledge and agree that this Revision constitutes a material amendment to the Agreement and that each Partner is bound by its terms. The Manager agrees to implement this Revision promptly upon execution, and any further modifications or amendments to the Agreement must be agreed upon in writing by all parties.

original: C.  The Partnership, the Partners and Manager desire to amend the Agreement to extend the term of the Agreement and to add a new section concerning curtailment of the LIFO Partners (as defined below), all as set forth in this Amendment.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
C.  This Amendment, initiated by the desire of the Partnership, the Partners, and Manager, seeks to amend the Agreement, not only for an extension of its term but also for the inclusion of a new section on the potential suspension of LIFO Partners (as defined), as detailed in this document. In essence, we are considering a possible modification rather than an absolute amendment, to reflect this change in context.

original: In connection with any attempt to eliminate the cause of any curtailment, no change to the Transmission Line shall be made without the prior unanimous consent of the Partners (excluding the LIFO Partners), which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld." (c)  Existing Section 7.4 shall be renumbered as Section 7.5.
ollama_generated:
In the event of an endeavor to address any interruption, it is expressly agreed that no alteration may be made to the Transmission Line without the subsequent written consent of all Partners (excluding LIFO Partners), and the Partners reserve the right to grant or withhold such consent in a timely manner, albeit not arbitrarily. (d) The current Section 7.4 shall hereafter be designated as Section 7.6.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the responsibility slightly by allowing the Partners to grant or withhold their consent at their discretion rather than specifying that they should not unreasonably withhold it. Additionally, I have renumbered the section as indicated in the original clause.

original: 2.  Continuing Validity. Except as expressly modified by Section 1 of this ------------------- Amendment, all of the terms and conditions of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. By execution of this Amendment, Alpha Mariah (Prime), Inc. and Beta Mariah (Prime), Inc. hereby become parties to the Agreement and agree to be bound by all of the terms of the Agreement and this Amendment.
ollama_generated: 2. Persisting Applicability. Save for the amendments specified in Section 1 of this Supplemental Agreement, the original terms and conditions of the Agreement shall continue to apply unchanged. By signing this Supplemental Agreement, Alpha Mariah (Prime), Inc. and Beta Mariah (Prime), Inc. acknowledge their acceptance of the Agreement's terms and conditions, including this Supplemental Agreement. Effectively, both parties consent to be bound by the original Agreement and any subsequent modifications outlined within it.

original: TOYOWEST MANAGEMENT INC., a California corporation --------------------------------- Name:  Robert L. Eisen Title:  Vice President Date:  Dec 28, 1990 Partners, on behalf of themselves and ------------------------------------- Sagebrush:

TOYOWEST MANAGEMENT INC., a California corporation -- hereafter referred to as "Toyowest" -- addresses the entity known as "Sagebrush," effective from December 28, 1990.

- Name: Robert L. Eisen, Vice President of Toyowest

In this agreement, it is understood that Sagebrush shall hold responsibility for any and all actions undertaken in the performance of their duties, rather than Toyowest bearing this liability. Any potential claims or disputes arising from these activities shall be resolved solely by Sagebrush, with Toyowest being absolved from any involvement or obligation in such proceedings.

- Name: Sagebrush

In a reciprocal arrangement, Toyowest grants Sagebrush the freedom to act independently and make decisions without prior approval, as long as these actions align with the general objectives of this partnership. However, it is acknowledged that Sagebrush shall bear full responsibility for any consequences or repercussions stemming from such decisions.

- Name: Toyowest Management Inc.

--------------------------------- Name: Robert L. Eisen Title: Vice President Date: Dec 28, 1990

SAGEBRUSH PARTNER ELEVEN, INC., a California corporation, hereinafter referred to as "Contractor," and BETA MARIAH (PRIME), INC., a California corporation, hereinafter referred to as "Principal," acknowledge the following:

From the date hereof until the termination of this agreement or the completion of all services outlined in this contract, whichever occurs first, Contractor shall perform all duties and obligations specified herein to the best of its ability. However, it is expressly understood that failure by the Principal to fulfill its obligations under this contract shall not relieve the Contractor of its responsibilities or liabilities under this agreement.

In case of any breach or non-performance of the duties and obligations by either party, the other party shall not be required to perform any further obligations or services hereunder until such breach or default is remedied to the reasonable satisfaction of the aggrieved party. The aggrieved party may also terminate this agreement upon thirty (30) days' written notice to the breaching party, in which case the non-breaching party shall be entitled to any amounts owed under this contract at the time of such termination, less any amounts already paid or otherwise offset by the breaching party.

The Principal agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Contractor from any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses arising out of or resulting from any negligence or willful misconduct on the part of the Principal in connection with this agreement. The Principal's obligation to indemnify shall survive the termination or expiration of this agreement.

This agreement may not be amended except by a written instrument executed by both parties. This agreement is governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California, without giving effect to its conflict of law principles. Any action arising under this agreement shall be brought only in the state or federal courts located in San Francisco County, California, and the parties consent to the jurisdiction of such courts.

This agreement represents the entire understanding between the parties regarding the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous oral or written agreements. This agreement may not be assigned by either party without the prior written consent of the other party, except that the Principal may assign this agreement in connection with a merger, sale of substantially all of its assets, or change of control, provided that the assignee agrees to be bound by the terms and conditions of this agreement.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this agreement as of the date first above written.

SAGEBRUSH PARTNER ELEVEN, INC.,
